abstract: Citigroup on Monday sold $6 billion of preferred shares to shore up its balance sheet after the largest United States bank recorded over $16 billion in write-downs and credit losses in the first quarter.
lead_paragraph: Citigroup on Monday sold $6 billion of preferred shares to shore up its balance sheet after the largest United States bank recorded over $16 billion in write-downs and credit losses in the first quarter.

headline.main: Citigroup Raises $6 Billion in Capital Markets
